text:
Lebeziatnikov looked anxious. 

"I’ve come to you, Sofya Semyonovna," he stammered. 

He turned to Raskolnikov. "Katerina Ivanovna has gone mad." 

Sonia screamed. 

"She came back beaten. She ran to your father’s chief. He wasn’t home." 

Lebeziatnikov continued, "She begged to see him. They turned her away." 

"She abused him," he said, shaking his head. 

"Now she’s shouting. She’ll take the children into the street." 

Sonia gasped. 

"With a barrel-organ," he added, eyes wide. 

"What can we do?"

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Katerina Ivanovna is in a state of distress, having been turned away from a general's dinner and threatening to take her children to the streets.
